newsitem.title: UK: Odds on UK Conservatives election win cut.
newsitem.headline: Odds on UK Conservatives election win cut.

text.p: British bookmaker Ladbrokes said on Friday it cut the odds on the ruling Conservatives winning the next election to 9-4 from 5-2 after good betting support.
The odds on the main opposition Labour party winning the most seats at the election, due by May 1997, lengthened to 2-7 from 1-4. Labour leads in the opinion polls by about 20 points.
The Liberal Democrats remain at 250-1 to win the election.
May is the most favoured month for the election -- 4-11 -- with April quoted at 9-4.
